intro: Chassalia elongata, commonly known as the long-stemmed chassalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllis family (Amaryllidaceae) and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its striking appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Chassalia elongata is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
